Package org.opengrok.indexer.analysis

Class ZeroReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • org.opengrok.indexer.analysis.ZeroReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Readable
    public class ZeroReader
extends java.io.Reader
    Represents a Reader wrapper that guards against implementations that might return zero characters instead of properly blocking.

    If zero character returns are rare, efficiency loss will be minimal.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.io.Reader

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public int read​(char[] cbuf,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Read len characters from the underlying Reader into the buffer cbuf at offset off, blocking until input is available or end-of-stream is reached.

        Relies on the method Reader.read() of the underlying Reader to block until at least one character is available or end-of-stream is reached.

        Specified by:
        read in class java.io.Reader
        Parameters:
        cbuf - the buffer to write into
        off - the offset at which to write
        len - the maximum number of characters to write
        Returns:
        -1 for end of stream; number of characters read otherwise. Returns 0 if and only if len is equal to 0.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If off is negative, or len is negative, or len is greater than cbuf.length - off

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the underlying Reader.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in class java.io.Reader
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if thrown by the underlying Reader
